body.p: The AI Threads page provides an overview of initial user messages sent to the AI Assistant on your site. Users with an Owner, Admin, or Moderator role have access to this page.

section.title: Filtering Threads
section.p: You can filter AI threads using several options:

ol.li:
Thread Status Filters: Click the status filter buttons to view threads categorized as:
Useful: Helpful or informative messages.
Not Useful: Messages deemed unhelpful.
Invalidated: Messages flagged for containing inaccurate or irrelevant information.
Error: Cases where the AI Assistant failed to respond correctly.
All: Displays all messages.

Dropdown Filters:
Filter threads by specific site versions or time frames.
Search Field: Enter keywords to search for specific content within threads.

section.title: Thread Indicators
section.p: Each message includes tags on the right side to indicate its assessment:

ul.li: Useful: The message is helpful or informative.
Not Useful: The message lacks helpful information.
Inaccurate: The message contains unrelated information.
Error: The AI Assistant encountered an issue and failed to provide a valid response.

ol.li: Locate the desired message in the list.
Click the "View Thread" button next to the message.
Access the full conversation to review user interactions and take appropriate actions.

section.title: AI Assistant Conversation Details
section.p: Clicking the "View Thread" button opens a new page displaying the full conversation with the AI Assistant. This page provides a detailed view of the interaction between the user and the AI Assistant, along with context and analysis to help administrators evaluate the assistant's performance. Key features include:

li.p: At the top of the page, you’ll find essential details about the conversation:

ul.li: Date and Time: When the interaction occurred.
Site Version: The version of your site where the conversation took place, allowing you to track changes across versions.

li.p: A quick overview of the AI Assistant's replies is displayed, breaking down the interaction into these categories:

ul.li: Total Responses: The total number of replies from the assistant.
Useful Responses: Messages categorized as helpful or informative.
Not Useful Responses: Messages that lacked helpful information.
Inaccurate Responses: Replies containing unrelated information.
Errors: Instances where the AI Assistant encountered an issue and failed to provide a valid response.

li.p: Gain a deeper understanding of the user’s experience:

ul.li: User Input: Review the questions or statements provided by the user.
AI Responses: See the assistant’s replies and evaluate their accuracy and relevance.
Referenced Documentation: Identify the topics from your documentation that the AI Assistant cited in its responses.

li.p: Use this detailed view to assess the quality of the AI Assistant's performance, identify trends in user queries, and improve responses by updating your documentation or AI settings.
